title: Stand-alone NASIS Interpretation Engine
text: many reasons wanting develop, test, apply interpretations soil data outside context NASIS. project aims create prototype existing interpretation rules, evaluations, properties managed NASIS. prototype complete possible generate fuzzy ratings arbitrary sources soil environmental data sources.

title: Stand-alone NASIS Interpretation Engine
text: data.tree package defines objects methods well suited task describing hierarchy rules evaluations. NASIS evaluations utilize definitions shape functions cubic splines, interpolated using approxfun() splinefun(). NASIS hedges operators perform arithmetic operations numeric matrices facilitate combining multiple properties evaluations rules.

title: Stand-alone NASIS Interpretation Engine
text: Load rules, evaluations, properties R via ODBC data.frame objects Load single rule (recursively) load sub-rules data.tree object Load evaluation functions terminal node data.tree object Load hedge operator functions decision node data.tree object Send properties evaluation functions Combine fuzzy values via operators hedges generate final fuzzy rating

title: Stand-alone NASIS Interpretation Engine
text: following images show output evaluation function slope ("*Storie Factor C Slope 0 100%") NASIS.
code: eval <- subset(NASIS_evaluations, evalname == "*Storie Factor C Slope 0 to 100%") plotEvaluation(eval, xlim = c(0, 100)) # zoom in on  custom shape in [0, 8]% slope range plotEvaluation(eval, xlim = c(0,8))

what: Run a rule tree with custom data
title: Stand-alone NASIS Interpretation Engine
text: interpret() function takes data.frame SpatRaster column variable names correspond input property names. Property names can extracted using getPropertySet() made compatible names using base R function make.names(). pick simple rule utilizes one property evaluation (“Erodibility Factor Maximum”). numeric input evaluation function erodibility (“K”) factor ranging 0 1.
code: # parse rule and properties r <- initRuleset("Erodibility Factor Maximum") p <- getPropertySet(r)  # prepare input data kf <- seq(0, 1, 0.01) input <- data.frame(kf = kf) colnames(input) <- make.names(p$propname)  # run interpretation output <- interpret(r, input)  # visualize results plot(output$rating ~ input$SOIL.EROSION.FACTOR.MAXIMUM.1.99)

code:
propdefByPropname("SOIL REACTION 1-1 WATER IN DEPTH 0-100cm (min)") #> [[1]] #>     propiid #> 442   10195 #>                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                         propdesc #> 442 Finds the minimum value of soil reaction (pH) for the horizon that has any portion in a depths less than 40" (100 cm).
Portions outside the depth range are not considered in the horizon thickness.

Returns values for low, high and rv: each has a single value. #>                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                         prop #> 442 base table component.
 
# Finds the minimum value of soil reaction (pH) for the horizon that has any portion in a depths less than 40" (100 cm).
 
exec sql select hzdept_r, hzdepb_r, ph1to1h2o_l, ph1to1h2o_h, ph1to1h2o_r, ph01mcacl2_l, ph01mcacl2_h, ph01mcacl2_r
    from  component, chorizon
    where join component to chorizon and (hzdept_r < 100 or hzdept_r=100);
    sort by hzdept_r, hzdepb_r
    aggregate column  ph1to1h2o_l min, ph1to1h2o_h min, ph1to1h2o_r min, ph01mcacl2_l min, ph01mcacl2_h min, ph01mcacl2_r min.
    
    define rv NOT ISNULL (ph1to1h2o_r) ? ph1to1h2o_r : ph01mcacl2_r.
    define low NOT ISNULL (ph1to1h2o_l) ? ph1to1h2o_l : ph01mcacl2_l.
    define high NOT ISNULL (ph1to1h2o_h) ? ph1to1h2o_h : ph01mcacl2_h. #>
